articles.author: Timour Azhari, Ari Rabinovitch
articles.description: Israel bombed central Beirut in the early hours of Thursday, killing at least six people, after its forces suffered their deadliest day on the Lebanese front in a year of clashes against Iran-backed armed group Hezbollah.
articles.title: Israel strikes heart of Beirut, killing six

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Russian troops are in complete control of the town of Vuhledar in Ukraine's eastern Donetsk region, the SHOT Telegram channel and pro-Russian war bloggers said on Wednesday.
articles.title: Russian forces in complete control of Vuhledar in eastern Ukraine, war bloggers say

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Six migrants died after Mexican soldiers fired on a group of 33 migrants traveling in a pick-up truck that had tried to evade a military patrol, the defense ministry said on Wednesday, underlining tensions on Mexico's southern border as it faces U.S. pressure to contain migration.
articles.title: Six migrants die after Mexican soldiers fire on pick-up truck

articles.author: Alexandra Ulmer, Rachael Levy
articles.description: Elon Musk secretly funded a conservative political group in recent years, according to four people familiar with his donations, illustrating quiet financial support for right-wing causes even before the billionaire entrepreneur in July endorsed former President Donald Trump's bid for re-election.
articles.title: Exclusive: Musk funded right-wing political non-profit years before he endorsed Trump, sources say

articles.author: Yimou Lee, Fabian Hamacher, Ann Wang
articles.description: Taiwan on Thursday girded itself for the arrival of a weakening Typhoon Krathon which has killed two people so far, as the island shut down for a second day with hundreds of flights grounded and financial markets closed.
articles.title: Taiwan girds for weakening Typhoon Krathon, shuts down for second day

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The Haitian government's anti-corruption agency charged five high-profile individuals with corruption on Wednesday, including three members of an interim governing council, over a scandal involving bribing the chairman of a state-owned bank.
articles.title: Haiti anti-graft investigators accuse top-ranking officials of corruption

articles.author: Samia Nakhoul, Laila Bassam
articles.description: Iran's Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei warned Hezbollah leader Syyed Hassan Nasrallah to flee Lebanon days before he was killed in an Israeli strike and is now deeply worried about Israeli infiltration of senior government ranks in Tehran, three Iranian sources said.
articles.title: Exclusive: Iran's Khamenei warned Nasrallah of Israeli plot to kill him, sources say

articles.author: Special Reports
articles.description: The vast underground chamber and its vast network of tunnels keep the metropolis from flooding, but as global warming causes more severe weather, authorities are having to give the system a major upgrade.
articles.title: Tokyo expands underground 'temple' complex to counter climate change

articles.author: Xinghui Kok
articles.description: A Singapore court on Thursday sentenced a former minister to 12 months in prison for obstructing justice and receiving more than $300,000 worth of gifts, in the first jailing of an ex-cabinet member in a city-state famous for its clean governance.
articles.title: Singapore's disgraced former minister S. Iswaran jailed in landmark case

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Bangladesh's interim government has recalled five envoys, including the ambassador to neighbouring India, in a major diplomatic reshuffle, a foreign ministry official said on Thursday.
articles.title: Bangladesh recalls five envoys in major diplomatic reshuffle
